--- title: "Tidy Tuesday (05/30/2023): Centenarians" author: "Dave Tirtariyadi" date: "2023-05-30" categories: [tidy tuesday] execute: message: false warning: false cache: true --- In this post, I analyze data on the oldest centenarians in the world! The main dataset was produced by frankiethull and can be found [here](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2023/2023-05-30). The dataset contains the oldest 100 known verified male and female centenarians. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/load-data-pkgs_5ec4169950b935855ceff60557a50f10'} ::: Let's skim the dataset first. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/skim-data_4292af1802fa0be8d5a0523a9fe5b2c0'} ::: {.cell-output-display}
Data summary
Name centenarians
Number of rows 200
Number of columns 8
_______________________
Column type frequency:
character 4
Date 2
numeric 2
________________________
Group variables None
**Variable type: character**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max empty n_unique whitespace
name 0 1 9 31 0 200 0
place_of_death_or_residence 0 1 4 25 0 34 0
gender 0 1 4 6 0 2 0
still_alive 0 1 5 8 0 2 0
**Variable type: Date**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max median n_unique
birth_date 0 1.00 1856-06-15 1911-12-05 1900-05-23 199
death_date 12 0.94 1968-03-21 2023-04-17 2014-01-02 186
**Variable type: numeric**
skim_variable n_missing complete_rate mean sd p0 p25 p50 p75 p100 hist
rank 0 1 50.44 28.90 1.00 25.75 50.50 75.25 100.00 ▇▇▇▇▇
age 0 1 114.06 1.93 111.46 112.26 114.57 115.29 122.45 ▇▇▂▁▁
::: ::: We see that there are eight variables in the dataset, including `place_of_death_or_residence`, `gender`, and `birth_date`. Cool thing: the average age of the 100 oldest male and female centenarians is **114 years old**! # Exploratory data analysis ## Location Let's first take a look at where the 100 oldest male and female centenarians come from. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/top-ten-country_fea3e1f8d4f8950fd0811db436a4e80a'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Top Ten Countries with the Highest Number of Centenarians
Country Count
United States 66
Japan 46
France 9
Italy 9
Spain 9
United Kingdom 9
Brazil 6
Canada 5
Portugal 5
Mexico 4
````` ::: ::: We see that the **United States** and **Japan** dominate the list of countries, accounting for more than half of the entire dataset of 200 centenarians! How about if we analyze on the continent-level? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/continent-rank_fafeaec0350df51824d8991ec72eca83'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/continent-rank-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Let's take a closer look at centenarians from the United States and Japan. What does the gender distribution look like? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/gender-us-japan_5e134dad0d2aeda4c4d441b1162e9be8'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Gender Distribution among Centenarians in the United States and Japan
Country Female Male
Japan 25 21
United States 36 30
````` ::: ::: We see that there is an almost equal split between male and female in Japan and the United States. ## Birth date Are centenarians more likely to be born on a certain month? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/month-dist_abed648aed6068fb15db060013c7d050'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/month-dist-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: There's no clear winner here, but the top two months are **May** and **August**. Were centenarians who were born earlier in history more like to reach an older age? ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/age-vs-birth-date_c0cb5b0990d7ddd54479ae526cd6283f'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/age-vs-birth-date-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
